speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: SCENE VI. The same. A room in the brothel.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Enter Pandar, Bawd, and BOULT

speaker: Pandar
text_entry: Well, I had rather than twice the worth of her she

speaker: Pandar
text_entry: had ne'er come here.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Fie, fie upon her! she's able to freeze the god

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Priapus, and undo a whole generation. We must

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: either get her ravished, or be rid of her. When she

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: should do for clients her fitment, and do me the

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: kindness of our profession, she has me her quirks,

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: her reasons, her master reasons, her prayers, her

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: knees; that she would make a puritan of the devil,

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: if he should cheapen a kiss of her.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: 'Faith, I must ravish her, or she'll disfurnish us

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: of all our cavaliers, and make our swearers priests.

speaker: Pandar
text_entry: Now, the pox upon her green-sickness for me!

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: 'Faith, there's no way to be rid on't but by the

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: way to the pox. Here comes the Lord Lysimachus disguised.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: We should have both lord and lown, if the peevish

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: baggage would but give way to customers.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Enter LYSIMACHUS

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: How now! How a dozen of virginities?

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Now, the gods to-bless your honour!

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: I am glad to see your honour in good health.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: You may so; 'tis the better for you that your

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: resorters stand upon sound legs. How now!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: wholesome iniquity have you that a man may deal

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: withal, and defy the surgeon?

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: We have here one, sir, if she would--but there never

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: came her like in Mytilene.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: If she'ld do the deed of darkness, thou wouldst say.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Your honour knows what 'tis to say well enough.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Well, call forth, call forth.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: For flesh and blood, sir, white and red, you shall

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: see a rose; and she were a rose indeed, if she had but--

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: What, prithee?

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: O, sir, I can be modest.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: That dignifies the renown of a bawd, no less than it

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: gives a good report to a number to be chaste.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Exit BOULT

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Here comes that which grows to the stalk; never

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: plucked yet, I can assure you.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Re-enter BOULT with MARINA

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Is she not a fair creature?

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: 'Faith, she would serve after a long voyage at sea.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Well, there's for you: leave us.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: I beseech your honour, give me leave: a word, and

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: I'll have done presently.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I beseech you, do.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: [To MARINA]  First, I would have you note, this is

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: an honourable man.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I desire to find him so, that I may worthily note him.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Next, he's the governor of this country, and a man

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: whom I am bound to.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: If he govern the country, you are bound to him

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: indeed; but how honourable he is in that, I know not.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Pray you, without any more virginal fencing, will

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: you use him kindly? He will line your apron with gold.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: What he will do graciously, I will thankfully receive.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Ha' you done?

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: My lord, she's not paced yet: you must take some

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: pains to work her to your manage. Come, we will

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: leave his honour and her together. Go thy ways.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Exeunt Bawd, Pandar, and BOULT

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Now, pretty one, how long have you been at this trade?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: What trade, sir?

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Why, I cannot name't but I shall offend.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I cannot be offended with my trade. Please you to name it.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: How long have you been of this profession?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: E'er since I can remember.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Did you go to 't so young? Were you a gamester at

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: five or at seven?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Earlier too, sir, if now I be one.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Why, the house you dwell in proclaims you to be a

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: creature of sale.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Do you know this house to be a place of such resort,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: and will come into 't? I hear say you are of

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: honourable parts, and are the governor of this place.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Why, hath your principal made known unto you who I am?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Who is my principal?

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Why, your herb-woman; she that sets seeds and roots

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: of shame and iniquity. O, you have heard something

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: of my power, and so stand aloof for more serious

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: wooing. But I protest to thee, pretty one, my

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: authority shall not see thee, or else look friendly

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: upon thee. Come, bring me to some private place:

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: come, come.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: If you were born to honour, show it now;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: If put upon you, make the judgment good

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: That thought you worthy of it.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: How's this? how's this? Some more; be sage.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: For me,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: That am a maid, though most ungentle fortune

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Have placed me in this sty, where, since I came,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Diseases have been sold dearer than physic,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: O, that the gods

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Would set me free from this unhallow'd place,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Though they did change me to the meanest bird

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: That flies i' the purer air!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I did not think

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Thou couldst have spoke so well; ne'er dream'd thou couldst.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Had I brought hither a corrupted mind,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Thy speech had alter'd it. Hold, here's gold for thee:

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Persever in that clear way thou goest,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: And the gods strengthen thee!

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: The good gods preserve you!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: For me, be you thoughten

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: That I came with no ill intent; for to me

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: The very doors and windows savour vilely.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Fare thee well. Thou art a piece of virtue, and

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I doubt not but thy training hath been noble.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Hold, here's more gold for thee.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: A curse upon him, die he like a thief,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: That robs thee of thy goodness! If thou dost

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Hear from me, it shall be for thy good.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Re-enter BOULT

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: I beseech your honour, one piece for me.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Avaunt, thou damned door-keeper!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Your house, but for this virgin that doth prop it,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Would sink and overwhelm you. Away!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: How's this? We must take another course with you.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: If your peevish chastity, which is not worth a

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: breakfast in the cheapest country under the cope,

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: shall undo a whole household, let me be gelded like

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: a spaniel. Come your ways.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Whither would you have me?

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: I must have your maidenhead taken off, or the common

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: hangman shall execute it. Come your ways. We'll

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: have no more gentlemen driven away. Come your ways, I say.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Re-enter Bawd

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: How now! what's the matter?

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Worse and worse, mistress; she has here spoken holy

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: words to the Lord Lysimachus.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: O abominable!

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: She makes our profession as it were to stink afore

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: the face of the gods.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Marry, hang her up for ever!

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: The nobleman would have dealt with her like a

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: nobleman, and she sent him away as cold as a

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: snowball; saying his prayers too.

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Boult, take her away; use her at thy pleasure:

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: crack the glass of her virginity, and make the rest malleable.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: An if she were a thornier piece of ground than she

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: is, she shall be ploughed.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Hark, hark, you gods!

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: She conjures: away with her! Would she had never

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: come within my doors! Marry, hang you! She's born

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: to undo us. Will you not go the way of women-kind?

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Marry, come up, my dish of chastity with rosemary and bays!

speaker: Bawd
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Come, mistress; come your ways with me.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Whither wilt thou have me?

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: To take from you the jewel you hold so dear.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Prithee, tell me one thing first.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Come now, your one thing.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: What canst thou wish thine enemy to be?

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Why, I could wish him to be my master, or rather, my mistress.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Neither of these are so bad as thou art,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Since they do better thee in their command.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Thou hold'st a place, for which the pained'st fiend

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Of hell would not in reputation change:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Thou art the damned doorkeeper to every

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Coistrel that comes inquiring for his Tib;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: To the choleric fisting of every rogue

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Thy ear is liable; thy food is such

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: As hath been belch'd on by infected lungs.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: What would you have me do? go to the wars, would

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: you? where a man may serve seven years for the loss

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: of a leg, and have not money enough in the end to

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: buy him a wooden one?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Do any thing but this thou doest. Empty

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: OLD receptacles, or common shores, of filth;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Serve by indenture to the common hangman:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Any of these ways are yet better than this;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: For what thou professest, a baboon, could he speak,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Would own a name too dear. O, that the gods

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Would safely deliver me from this place!

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Here, here's gold for thee.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: If that thy master would gain by thee,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Proclaim that I can sing, weave, sew, and dance,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: With other virtues, which I'll keep from boast:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And I will undertake all these to teach.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I doubt not but this populous city will

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Yield many scholars.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: But can you teach all this you speak of?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Prove that I cannot, take me home again,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And prostitute me to the basest groom

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: That doth frequent your house.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Well, I will see what I can do for thee: if I can

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: place thee, I will.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But amongst honest women.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: 'Faith, my acquaintance lies little amongst them.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: But since my master and mistress have bought you,

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: there's no going but by their consent: therefore I

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: will make them acquainted with your purpose, and I

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: doubt not but I shall find them tractable enough.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Come, I'll do for thee what I can; come your ways.

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Exeunt
